title: [K-12] Development of Instructional Methods Using Interactive E-books in High School Social Studies

context.prior_knowledge: Basic digital literacy and foundational understanding of social studies concepts
context.additional_context: Conducts blended classes using interactive e-books for social studies learning in environments where digital devices (tablets/laptops) are provided. Students engage in both theoretical learning and digital media production/analysis activities

learning_goals: Learners can explain core social studies concepts (e.g., principles of democracy, economic systems) with over 80% accuracy using multimedia features of interactive e-books
Learners can apply metacognitive strategies at least three times during problem-solving processes using interactive elements (quizzes, virtual experiments, etc.) within e-books
Learners can self-regulate distractions (messengers, games, etc.) while using digital devices and e-books, increasing focused learning time by over 20% compared to baseline

resources: 5 Social Studies eBooks Linked to Textbooks

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
